measured_by: difference between average reaction time post-error and average reaction time post-correct
justification: The article states that “Dutilh et al (2012, Table 1) summarize the standard way to assess speeding or slowing as calculating the difference between average reaction time post-error minus average reaction time post-correct for each participant,” explicitly linking the construct to this RT-difference measure.

The text notes that “neural signals generated by negative feedback (e.g., feedback-related negativity; FRN) modulate less than the FRN generated by positive feedback,” identifying FRN as the instrument used to capture neural responses to feedback.
construct: neural response to negative versus positive feedback
